arm_group.description: Patients in this group will receive placebo
Patients in this group will receive Tamsulosin
Patients in this group will receive Solifenacin

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will be conducted to compare the effectiveness of alpha blocker (Tamsulosin) and
      Anticholinergic (Solifenacin) in relieving lower urinary tract symptoms caused DJ ureteral
      stents.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Tamsulosin and Solifenacin in Treatment of Ureteral Stent Symptoms

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Patient who will undergo DJ stent fixation after endoscopic procedures

          1. Patient aged from 20-50 years.

          2. Sexually active.

          3. Indwelling time less than 3 month.

          4. Unilateral DJ stent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Patients who had LUTS before DJ stent fixation.

          2. DJ stent fixation after open surgery.

          3. Indwelling time more than 3 month.

          4. Bilateral DJ stent.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Clinical Trial Comparing Alpha Blacker (Tamsulosin) and Anticholinergic (Solifenacin) in Treatment of Ureteral Stent Related Symptoms

overall_official.affiliation: Urology and Nephrology Center, Mansoura University

primary_outcome.measure: The Efficacy of tamsolusin and solifenacin in relieving ureteral stent symptoms will be evaluated by comparing the scores of ureteral stent symptoms quesionnaire in the studied groups

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
